page.title: 06Employment in Eversley
page.content: There is very little employment in Eversley but an old petrol station has recently been bought and adapted by an electronic company.They make light beam recorders used in the dairy, horticultural,motor and aviation industries.We spoke to Mr.Appleby, the managing director of{Micromovements {Ltd,}and he told us that they employ twenty local people but are planning to expand soon.Their equipment is sent all over the world, including America. He told us that some of the employees are university graduates with engineering degrees.The other staff need to be dextrous with good hand / eye control, as their work involves fitting tiny components together often using microscopes.The light beam recorders go to large companies such as Honeywell and are mostly used for research purposes.
